title: Recommendations
fullText:
The following practices are recommended:
(a) Where practical, all tools should be insulated.
(b) Battery cable lug terminations should be crimped using the appropriate crimping tool to the manufacturer's recommendations.
(c) Use 'blind' terminal lugs and heat shrink to protect cable from the ingress of battery acid.
(d) Bolted connections should use stainless steel bolts, nuts and washers. The bolt tension should be tightened to the manufacturer's maximum torque specification and checked approximately thirty days later.
(e) No metallic jewellery, watches or the like should be worn during any battery work.
(f) The battery enclosure should be insect and vermin-proof.
